conclusion: Analyze v-t graphs of pedestrian and bus to determine if pedestrian can catch up.
Pedestrian's graph: straight line with constant velocity of 8 m/s from origin. Bus's graph: straight line with initial velocity 0 m/s, accelerating uniformly to 8 m/s.
Pedestrian is initially 36 meters away. Both reach 8 m/s, so distance remains constant and pedestrian cannot catch up.
Bus's acceleration does not change the fact that velocities are equal, so pedestrian will not close the gap.
